content: YouTrip DBS Multi Currency Account DBS Multi Currency Cards Asked by AnonymousAsked on 12 Nov 2018Is DBS Multi-Currency or YouTrip better as a multi-currency wallet for foreign transactions?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardUpdated on 11 Jun 2019Personally, I prefer Youtrip for the competitive rates.I just used Youtrip on my Japan trip, and found rates to be comparable to what I could get from the Raffles Place money changers.Another big plus - when I was out of JPY for a transaction, it converted my SGD to JPY. Which also means, no small change that I need to change back to SGD when I get back! For me, that's a nice plus since I typically don't like to change it back to local currency.I don't mind using it as a one-way wallet, because I use Youtrip as an EZ-Link card as well for my local commute!Get S$10 free money after your first top up on Youtrip with this link! https://youtrip.app.link/HUI%20JUN128899** **Update June 2019: 9 more available! 0 comments1

Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019If you're comparing by number of currencies either support, DBS Multi-Currency supports more (12 + SGD vs 10). If you do not have a DBS account, YouTrip will be a more convenient solution since it's an app.1 comment0

Lam Ka Ying16 May 2019Personally prefers Youtrip which seems to have smaller margins for their exchange rates (you can check in the app for both accounts). Youtrip also does not charge foreign transaction fees for currencies outside of the listed 10.
